notes: Fast alerting and visibility into failures

How can we measure the success of our UX features?
How do we measure developer productivity?
Plan your work in short reviewable bursts
I think we can do better than we currently do on all fronts!
Don't hide it
Avoid the blame game
Acknowledge, own it and take responsibility
See it as an opportunity to learn
Take the time to understand what was wrong
Use this knowledge to craft a new solution
Share any knoweldge you have gained!
Everyone writes buggy / bad code
Accept point 1
Detach yourself from your code, it's not you
Welcome criticism but defend your position when appropriate
Think about reviews as a process for better code delivery
Learn from your reviewers
Keep review sets small to attract multiple reviews
Expose yourself to new concepts and ideas
Challenge yourself to get better at what you do
If it’s not hard, if it doesn’t suck, you probably won’t learn much from it
Get out of your comfort zone
Review results and repeat the practice
New languages
New frameworks
New tech stacks
New ops processes
Dive into other teams / codebases at work
All the above will help you think differently about crafting solutions
Take responsibility for your own learning!
Work on side projects
Don't take on more than you can reasonably do in your work hours
Force yourself to take time to develop your skills
Try to avoid taking up too much of other peoples time
Ask for help if you've been stuck on something for too long
Determine (and stick to) an acceptible time period you can be stuck before asking for help
Take your 20% time!
Find a mentor (virtual / external)
Learn from co-workers
Go on training courses
Go to conferences
Spend your allocated budget!
Find and read about other peoples' experiences
Learn from others mistakes
Learn from the lessons of the past
Conduct our own on work we've done!
Links of articles / sites that interest you
Find out who is interested in what
Internal discussions / journal clubs
Go to local Meetups
Create a culture of discussing and sharing ideas!
Solicit feedback from co-workers
Each employee lists three to five co-workers they would like peer feedback from
Each co-worker writes down any behaviours they want you to 1. start, 2. stop and 3. continue doing
The co-worker should focus on behaviors that match the title, e.g. Start: Offering to make coffee each morning
Categories aren't mandatory, just leave it off if it doesn't apply
Do this every 3 / 6 months internally
Need to anonymize feedback between the worker and the co-workers feedback (web app?)
Set personal goals
Lodge this with your supervisor / person you trust
Create a review cycle to see how well you are doing
If needed - change your behaviour / goals based on self review
Follow up on this in the offical review
State how you have met / failed to meet your personal goals
Show how you have fulfilled your work projects
Try not to be over confident
Try not to be dismissive of your success
Acknowledge the help you've received
This is can be useful when matched to co-workers and supervisor feedback

Find comfortable places
Avoid interruptions
Try and work on one hard problem at a time
Keep context switching down to a minimum
Try to get in the zone for a few hours per day
Respect and trust your co-workers
Excerise, even just a little walk counts
Sleep well
Eat well
Don't spread yourself to thin
See points on taking time
If you need help, there are University people / services you can access
You can't work, think and write code if you aren't well
